JobFullDesc: Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.  Microsoft’s Global Trade Legal team advances this mission through international trade policies, solutions, and investigations that foster a culture of compliance, trust, and innovation across Microsoft and with our partners and customers worldwide. The Global Trade’s Risk Intelligence Group (RIG) specializes in advanced trade-related due diligence, investigations, forensic research, and risk monitoring in support of Microsoft’s trade compliance program. The Global Trade RIG Investigator’s responsibilities will include conducting and coordinating due diligence and investigative research, providing risk guidance to internal stakeholders, as well as project management, process improvement. You will be a trusted adviser to Microsoft’s internal business and legal teams on sanctions and export controls due diligence matters. You will lead and coordinate the day-to-day operations, including triage, review and sign-off on due diligence of key business-impacting deals. You will closely partner with other investigators and teams company-wide to conduct investigations into any trade-related issues that arise, confirm their root causes, and recommend remediation, as applicable. You will work with internal and external Trade Counsel to pro-actively monitor and analyze sanctions and export controls regulations, particularly impacting the Asia-Pacific (APAC) markets. You will provide relevant risk intelligence and apply your subject matter expertise to build, update, and streamline internal processes to reduce both regulatory and business risk for Microsoft. As a Global Trade’s RIG team member, you will benchmark with external industry groups and other relevant organizations to help ensure Microsoft’s best-in-class trade compliance program.  The role will report into the Global Trade Legal team within Corporate, External and Legal Affairs (CELA).ResponsibilitiesSupport internal Microsoft teams with sanctions and export controls due diligence by producing a thorough analysis of the applicable sanction regimes published by governments and international institutions, including but not limited to the United States, United Nations, and the European Union.
